entries.meaning: Agent noun of load; a person or device that loads.
examples: There was only one loader for the truck today so it took him a long time to get everything moved.
The auto-loader on the gun kept jamming so they did it manually.

entries.meaning: (computing) A program that prepares other programs for execution.
A tractor with a scoop, for example: front-end loader, front loader, endloader, payloader, bucket loader, wheel loader, etc.
(marketing) An incentive given to a dealer.
examples: Unique point-of-purchase materials and display loaders dramatically contribute to the display's attention-getting ability.
